intro: Schoutenia accrescens, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and elliptic in shape, with a smooth margin. Schoutenia accrescens produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by round, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed.
